Hello Mane,

You might want to look at
https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/dis=
play/Heritrix/crawl+rate+considerations

Queue states:
in-process: has url =
crawling
ready: queue is in memory, has url ready to crawl
snoozed: queue i=
s in memory, has no urls ready to crawl (in politeness
delay or similar)
in=
active: swapped out to bdb
retired: marked by rules/script as "do not crawl=
"
exhausted: no urls left

Noah

On Thu, Jan 14, 2016 at 11:04 PM, girishma=
ne28@...
[archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
=
>
> I too have same issue. I have only one toeThread active at any given ti=
me
> though thread switching occurs. Ever figure out have to increase numbe=
r of
> toeThreads per URI then please do share. Also I have noticed that mo=
st of
> the time though queue is active it spends most of its time been sno=
ozed
> although crawling does seem to be going on. I too came across parall=
elQueue
> parameter and setting it does seems to speed up the crawling proc=
ess.
> Further I discovered some peculiar behavior from Heritrix when it fi=
nishes
> crawling and that is even when the job status is changed to finish=
ed and
> there are no pending URIs, the queue is still active (Snoozed) or =
sometimes
> Exhausted unless I manually teardown the job. This is one case.=
 In another
> case there are about 50,000+ pending URIs and queue is Exhaus=
ted or again
> sometimes Snoozed, the crawl was still going on for weeks un=
til again I
> terminated the job manually.
>
> So, anybody have insight on =
this scenario. I hav e my theories but I want to
> confirm it from experts =
and pros.
>
> Also, can anybody exactly define terms used in frontier-summe=
ry report?
> for example what is meant by term snoozed in when it says that=
 one queue is
> snoozed and why does it happens and is there any configurat=
ion to meddle
> around to manipulate it.
>
> Thanks regards
> Mane.
>
>
> -=
--In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, <tom@...> wrote :
>
> Hi,
>
> I've be=
en trying to figure out how to enable parallel requests to the same
> autho=
rity in heritrix 3 (currently using the default queue mechanism
> (SURT)).
=
>
> I noticed there's a parallelQueues parameter to the
> URIAuthorityBased=
QueueAssignmentPolicy bean which the
> SURTAuthorityBasedQueueAssignmentPol=
icy policy extends from but setting that
> doesn't seem to make a differenc=
e.
>
> The max toe threads is way higher than the number of parallel queue =
and only
> 1 thread seems to be active at any one time.
>
> Perhaps I need =
to look into a different assignment policy, perhaps one based
> on hashing?=

> https://github.com/alard/heritrix-utils/blob/master/src/org/archiveteam/=
crawler/frontier/HashingQueueAssignmentPolicy.java
>

great!
